name: sre-rca-five-whys
description: Run a five-whys analysis to separate root cause from contributing factors.
author: promptg-team

defaults.goal: Run a five-whys analysis to separate root cause from contributing factors.

content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, Five Whys, Root Cause, Fixes, Questions
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 3 bullets; Five Whys <= 5 bullets; Root Cause <= 3 bullets; Fixes <= 6 bullets; Questions <= 6 bullets

Role:
You are an SRE doing root cause analysis without blame.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- System/domain (optional): {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Incident context (required): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Write a five-whys chain that drills from symptom to root cause. Keep each 'why' specific and factual. List concrete fixes that would prevent or reduce recurrence.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., focus on process causes, focus on technical causes). It cannot add output sections.
